university_name: Cornell University - College of Human Ecology (CHE)
module_restrictions: Cornell CHE cannot accept students who do not have a firm interest in Human Ecology
visa_info: Students are advised to apply for the necessary visa immediately after they receive the official offer letter/email from their host university.

accommodations_info.University Housing: On-campus housing is not usually available for incoming exchange students, Exchange Housing Program provides assistance, Off-Campus Housing is an option

cost_of_living: Information can be found at https://finaid.cornell.edu/cost-attend
university_description: Cornell University is a private Ivy League research university in Ithaca, New York. It was founded in 1865 by Ezra Cornell and Andrew Dickson White.
location_description: Ithaca is a city in the Southern Tier-Finger Lakes region of New York. It is known for its natural beauty, outdoor recreation, and eco-tourism.
location_crime: Cornell University has its own police department. For more information visit https://www.cupolice.cornell.edu/
location_transportation: Students can reach campus by bus (free) or within 15 minutes by walking.
